intro: Plectritis macrocera var. ciliosa, commonly known as the hairy plectritis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. Its small, yellowish flowers appear in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
